required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Intermittent Hypoxia (IH) on Metabolism and Dysglycemia, in Overweight/Obese Persons SCI
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Acute Intermittent Hypoxia (AIH) on Metabolism and Dysglycemia, in Overweight/Obese Persons With Spinal Cord Injuries (SCI)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research is to examine changes in blood glucose control and metabolism in individuals with SCI and non injured controls at rest and during exercise after five days of exposure to IH. This response will be compared with breathing normal room air (a SHAM control).

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Cardioendocrine Risk by Surrogate Blood Measures of the Homeostasis Model Assessment - Insulin Resistance (HOMA 2-IR)
primary_outcome.description: Insulin resistance was estimated by the Homeostasis Model Assessment of Insulin Resistance (HOMA2-IR), which is based on fasting glucose and insulin measurements. Values of > 1.8 were considered insulin resistant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Exercise Substrate Partitioning as Measured Via VO2 Peak Test
secondary_outcome.description: Change in exercise substrate partitioning as measured via endurance-maximal oxygen consumption (VO2peak test) and will be reported as change in carbohydrate oxidation (% of total energy expenditure).

arm_group.arm_group_label: Spinal Cord Injury (SCI) Intermittent Hypoxia then SHAM
arm_group.description: This arm of individuals with SCI will receive Intermittent Hypoxia (IH) and following a 3 week washout, SHAM treatment interventions.
This arm of non injured control subjects will receive Intermittent Hypoxia (IH) and following a 3 week washout, SHAM treatment interventions.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Spinal Cord Injury (SCI) SHAM then Intermittent Hypoxia
arm_group.description: This arm of individuals with SCI will receive SHAM and following a 3 week washout, Intermittent Hypoxia (IH) treatment interventions.
This arm of non injured control subjects will receive SHAM and following a 3 week washout, Intermittent Hypoxia (IH) treatment interventions.

intervention.description: Administered over a period of 5 consecutive days involving daily, hour long sessions of alternating 6-minute hypoxic intervals (FIO2 = 0.09-0.12) with 3-minute normoxic intervals (FIO2 = 0.21). During hypoxic intervals, oxygen concentration may be adjusted to maintain participants SpO2 levels between 75-90%.
intervention.arm_group_label: Spinal Cord Injury (SCI) Intermittent Hypoxia then SHAM
Spinal Cord Injury (SCI) SHAM then Intermittent Hypoxia

intervention.description: Administered over a period of 5 consecutive days involving daily, hour long sessions of alternating 6-minute normoxic intervals (FIO2 = 0.21) with 3-minute normoxic intervals (FIO2 = 0.21).
intervention.arm_group_label: Spinal Cord Injury (SCI) Intermittent Hypoxia then SHAM
Spinal Cord Injury (SCI) SHAM then Intermittent Hypoxia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
SCI only:
1. Lower extremity weakness or paralysis at C5 or below resulting from spinal cord injury for at least one year.
2. ASIA Classification A-D Overweight or obese as classified by a Body Mass Index (BMI) (kg/m2) of ≥ 25.0 (CON) and ≥ 22.0 (SCI).
SCI and non injured control:
Resting SaO2 ≥ 95%
Exclusion Criteria (SCI and non injured control):
1. Currently hospitalized
2. Resting heart rate ≥120 BPM
3. Resting systolic blood pressure >180 mm Hg
4. Resting diastolic Blood Pressure >100 mmHg
5. Self-reported history of unstable angina or myocardial infarction within the previous month
6. Previous cardiac surgery or condition that evidences ischemic heart disease
7. Cardiopulmonary complication such as COPD
8. Pregnancy determined by urine testing in sexually active females.

facility.name: The Miami Project to Cure Paralysis

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Spinal Cord Injury (SCI) Intermittent Hypoxia Then SHAM
group.description: This arm of individuals with SCI will receive Intermittent Hypoxia (IH) and following a 3 week washout, SHAM treatment interventions. Intermittent Hypoxia (IH): Administered over a period of 5 consecutive days involving daily, hour long sessions of alternating 6-minute hypoxic intervals (FIO2 = 0.09-0.12) with 3-minute normoxic intervals (FIO2 = 0.21). During hypoxic intervals, oxygen concentration may be adjusted to maintain participants SpO2 levels between 75-90%. SHAM: Administered over a period of 5 consecutive days involving daily, hour long sessions of alternating 6-minute normoxic intervals (FIO2 = 0.21) with 3-minute normoxic intervals (FIO2 = 0.21).

group.title: Control (CON) Intermittent Hypoxia Then SHAM
group.description: This arm of non injured control subjects will receive Intermittent Hypoxia (IH) and following a 3 week washout, SHAM treatment interventions. Intermittent Hypoxia (IH): Administered over a period of 5 consecutive days involving daily, hour long sessions of alternating 6-minute hypoxic intervals (FIO2 = 0.09-0.12) with 3-minute normoxic intervals (FIO2 = 0.21). During hypoxic intervals, oxygen concentration may be adjusted to maintain participants SpO2 levels between 75-90%. SHAM: Administered over a period of 5 consecutive days involving daily, hour long sessions of alternating 6-minute normoxic intervals (FIO2 = 0.21) with 3-minute normoxic intervals (FIO2 = 0.21).

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change in Cardioendocrine Risk by Surrogate Blood Measures of the Homeostasis Model Assessment - Insulin Resistance (HOMA 2-IR)
outcome.description: Insulin resistance was estimated by the Homeostasis Model Assessment of Insulin Resistance (HOMA2-IR), which is based on fasting glucose and insulin measurements. Values of > 1.8 were considered insulin resistant.
outcome.population: Unable to obtain blood samples from 2 participants in the control group and 1 participant withdrew prior to the baseline laboratory trial and therefore did not receive any intervention, therefore there is no reported data for the control group.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
